009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Scalar version of a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter described in [1]. It structures the filter region
018 * into five overlapping, square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for
019 * additional details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] F. Tomita and S. Tsuji. Extraction of multiple regions by smoothing in selected neighborhoods. IEEE Transactions
023 * on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics 7, 394â€“407 (1977).
024 * <br>
025 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
026 * (2022).
027 * </p>
028 *
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2021/01/02
031 */
032public class KuwaharaFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements KuwaharaF {
033        
034        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
035        private final int dm;                   // = d-
036        private final int dp;                   // = d+
037        private final float tsigma;
038
039        // constructor using default settings
040        public KuwaharaFilterScalar() {
041                this(new Parameters());
042        }
043        
044        public KuwaharaFilterScalar(Parameters params) {
045                int r = params.radius;
046                this.n = (r + 1) * (r + 1);             // size of complete filter
047                this.dm = (r / 2) - r;                  // d- = top/left center coordinate
048                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
049                this.tsigma = (float)params.tsigma;
050        }
051        
052        // ------------------------------------------------------
053
054        private float Smin;             // min. variance
055        private float Amin;                     
056        
057        @Override
058        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
059                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
060                evalSubregionGray(plane, u, v);         // a centered subregion (not in original Kuwahara)
061                Smin = Smin - tsigma * n;                               // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
062                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dm, v + dm);
063                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dm, v + dp);
064                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dp, v + dm);
065                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dp, v + dp);
066                
067                return Amin;
068        } 
069        
070        // sets the member variables Smin, Amin
071        private void evalSubregionGray(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
072                float S1 = 0; 
073                float S2 = 0;
074                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
075                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {
076                                float a = source.getVal(u+i, v+j);
077                                S1 = S1 + a;
078                                S2 = S2 + a * a;
079                        }
080                }
081//              double s = (sum2 - sum1*sum1/n)/n;      // actual sigma^2
082                float s = S2 - S1 * S1 / n;                     // s = n * sigma^2
083                if (s < Smin) {
084                        Smin = s;
085                        Amin = S1 / n; // mean
086                }
087        }
088}
